page.title: 06Farming in Henley District
page.content: On our survey we recorded how the farm land is used.We saw land belonging to Hernes Estate, Highlands Farm, Cowfield Farm, Upper House Farm and Kings Farm. Most of the land is used for arable purposes but some is grassland.The arable crops are mostly barley but there is also wheat, corn, broad beans and rape. We saw cattle on some of the grass land including calves and two fields of sheep.In one field there were three horses. Some farmers were haymaking, cutting and drying grass for winter feed for their animals. The farm houses were very old, very big and smart.
